name: Gentle Yoga for Period Relief
description: A gentle yoga sequence specifically designed to relieve menstrual cramps and lower back pain. This practice focuses on hip openers and gentle twists.
benefits: Reduces menstrual cramps, relieves lower back pain, calms the nervous system, improves blood circulation to pelvic area
instructions: Start in Child's Pose - kneel with knees wide, arms extended forward, rest forehead on mat for 5 deep breaths
Move to Cat-Cow - on all fours, alternate between arching and rounding spine for 10 repetitions
Reclined Butterfly - lie on back, soles of feet together, knees fall open, place hands on belly for 1 minute
Supine Twist - lying on back, bring knees to chest, drop both knees to one side, arms in T position, hold 30 seconds each side
Legs Up The Wall - lie with legs resting up against a wall for 2-3 minutes to reduce bloating and fatigue
youtube_video_title: Yoga For Period Relief - 15 Minute Practice

name: Anti-Bloating Stretch Routine
description: Gentle stretches that help reduce bloating and water retention common during menstruation. Focuses on abdominal compression and spinal twists.
benefits: Reduces bloating, aids digestion, relieves gas, reduces water retention, promotes lymphatic drainage
instructions: Wind-Relieving Pose - lie on back, hug right knee to chest, hold 30 seconds, switch sides
Supine Spinal Twist - lying down, cross right knee over body to left side, arms in T, look right, hold 1 minute each side
Seated Side Stretch - sit cross-legged, reach right arm overhead and lean left, hold 30 seconds each side
Cat-Cow Flow - on hands and knees, inhale arch back, exhale round spine, repeat 15 times slowly
Child's Pose with Belly Massage - in child's pose, gently rock side to side massaging abdomen

name: Cramp Relief Breathing
description: Deep breathing exercises that activate the parasympathetic nervous system to reduce pain perception and relax uterine muscles.
benefits: Reduces cramp intensity, activates body's natural pain relief, calms anxiety, promotes relaxation
instructions: Get comfortable - lie down with a pillow under your knees, or sit comfortably with back supported
Place one hand on chest, one on lower belly
Inhale slowly through nose for 4 counts, feeling belly rise
Hold breath gently for 4 counts
Exhale slowly through mouth for 6 counts, feeling belly fall
Repeat cycle 15-20 times, focusing on making exhale longer than inhale
Optional: Place a warm compress on lower abdomen while breathing

name: Pelvic Floor Relaxation
description: Exercises to consciously relax the pelvic floor muscles, reducing cramping and tension in the lower abdomen.
benefits: Reduces pelvic tension, alleviates cramps, improves blood flow, helps with heavy flow days
instructions: Happy Baby Pose - lie on back, grab outer edges of feet, knees toward armpits, rock gently side to side for 1 minute
Supported Bridge - lie on back, place a yoga block or firm pillow under sacrum, let hips rest, stay 2 minutes
Goddess Pose - lie on back, soles of feet together, knees wide, support knees with pillows, arms relaxed at sides, stay 3 minutes
Deep Squat with Support - hold onto a chair or wall, lower into a deep squat, let pelvic floor release, hold 30-60 seconds
Constructive Rest - lie on back, feet flat on floor hip-width apart, knees touching, arms relaxed, breathe deeply for 3 minutes

name: Gentle Hip Circles
description: Slow, circular movements of the hips to increase blood flow and reduce stiffness in the lower back and pelvis.
benefits: Increases circulation to reproductive organs, releases hip tension, reduces lower back pain, promotes flexibility
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, hands on hips
Begin making slow, large circles with your hips - 10 circles clockwise
Reverse direction - 10 circles counter-clockwise
On all fours, make circles with your hips - 10 each direction
Come to standing, feet wider than hips, circle hips in figure-8 pattern - 10 times
Finish with gentle swaying side to side for 1 minute

name: Lower Back Relief Stretches
description: Targeted stretches for the lower back which often gets sore during menstruation due to prostaglandin release.
benefits: Relieves lower back pain, reduces muscle tension, improves posture, helps with radiating leg pain
instructions: Knee-to-Chest Stretch - lie on back, hug both knees to chest, gentle rock side to side for 1 minute
Piriformis Stretch - cross right ankle over left knee, pull left thigh toward chest, hold 45 seconds each side
Seated Forward Fold - sit with legs extended, hinge at hips and reach for toes, hold 1 minute
Thread the Needle - on all fours, thread right arm under body, rest shoulder and head on floor, hold 30 seconds each side
Spinal Twist - sit cross-legged, twist to right placing left hand on right knee, look over right shoulder, hold 30 seconds each side
youtube_video_title: Lower Back Stretches for Period Pain

name: Restorative Yin Yoga
description: Ultra-gentle yoga with long-held poses using props for support. Perfect for days when energy is very low.
benefits: Deep relaxation, connective tissue release, stress reduction, improves sleep quality, hormone balance support
instructions: Supported Child's Pose - place a bolster or pillows lengthwise, rest torso on it, turn head to one side, stay 5 minutes
Supported Butterfly - sit with soles together, place bolsters under each knee for support, recline back onto pillows, stay 5 minutes
Supported Side-Lying Pose - lie on side with pillow between knees, pillow under head, stay 3 minutes each side
Supported Bridge - lie on back with block under sacrum, arms relaxed, stay 3 minutes
Legs Up Wall - sit sideways next to wall, swing legs up wall as you lower back down, stay 5 minutes

name: Gentle Walking
description: A light walk at a comfortable pace to boost endorphins and reduce menstrual discomfort without overexertion.
benefits: Natural pain relief through endorphins, improves mood, reduces fatigue, promotes blood circulation
instructions: Wear comfortable, supportive shoes
Start with 2-3 minutes of slow walking to warm up
Walk at a pace where you can comfortably hold a conversation
Focus on deep, rhythmic breathing
Swing arms naturally to engage upper body
If outdoors, choose a flat, safe route
Finish with 2-3 minutes of slower walking to cool down
Stretch calves and hips briefly after walking

name: Period-Safe Core Activation
description: Gentle core exercises that avoid putting pressure on the abdomen while maintaining strength. No crunches or planks.
benefits: Maintains core strength, supports lower back, safe for period days, improves posture
instructions: Diaphragmatic Breathing - lie on back, knees bent, breathe into belly feeling core engage on exhale, 10 breaths
Dead Bug (Modified) - lie on back, knees at 90°, slowly lower one heel to tap floor, alternate sides, 10 each side
Pelvic Tilts - lie on back, slowly tilt pelvis to flatten lower back against floor, release, repeat 15 times
Bird Dog - on all fours, extend opposite arm and leg simultaneously, hold 3 seconds, alternate, 8 each side
Side-Lying Leg Raises - lie on side, lift top leg slowly, lower with control, 12 each side

name: Calming Evening Stretches
description: Relaxing stretches to do before bed to improve sleep quality and reduce nighttime cramping.
benefits: Better sleep quality, reduces nighttime cramps, releases daily tension, calms nervous system
instructions: Neck Rolls - gently roll head in circles, 5 each direction, never force the movement
Shoulder Shrugs - inhale shoulders to ears, exhale drop them, repeat 10 times
Seated Cat-Cow - sit in chair or on floor, arch and round spine with breath, 10 repetitions
Reclined Figure-4 - lie on back, cross ankle over opposite knee, gently pull toward chest, 1 minute each side
Supine Butterfly - lie back, soles of feet together, knees wide, arms overhead, stay 3 minutes
Savasana - lie flat on back, let feet fall open, palms up, breathe naturally for 3 minutes

name: Energy Boost Yoga Flow
description: An invigorating yoga flow to harness rising energy during the follicular phase. Builds strength and flexibility.
benefits: Boosts energy, builds strength, increases flexibility, improves focus and concentration
instructions: Start in Mountain Pose - stand tall, feet together, arms at sides, take 3 deep breaths
Sun Salutation A - perform 5 rounds flowing through forward fold, plank, cobra, downward dog
Warrior I - step right foot forward, left foot angled, arms reach up, hold 5 breaths each side
Warrior II - from Warrior I, open hips to side, arms extend parallel to floor, hold 5 breaths each side
Triangle Pose - straighten front leg, reach forward then down to shin, other arm to sky, hold 5 breaths each side
Chair Pose - feet together, sink hips back like sitting in chair, arms overhead, hold 5 breaths
Cool down with Forward Fold and Savasana for 3 minutes

name: HIIT for High Energy Days
description: High-intensity interval training to maximize the high estrogen and energy of the ovulation phase.
benefits: Maximum calorie burn, builds endurance, releases endorphins, improves cardiovascular health
instructions: Warm up: 2 minutes of light jogging in place
Round 1 (repeat 4 times): 30 sec jumping jacks → 30 sec rest
Round 2 (repeat 4 times): 30 sec high knees → 30 sec rest
Round 3 (repeat 4 times): 30 sec burpees → 30 sec rest
Round 4 (repeat 4 times): 30 sec mountain climbers → 30 sec rest
Cool down: 3 minutes of walking in place and stretching

name: Strength Training - Full Body
description: Full body strength workout leveraging peak strength during the follicular and ovulation phases.
benefits: Builds muscle, increases metabolism, improves bone density, enhances body composition
instructions: Warm up: 3 minutes of light cardio and arm circles
Squats - 3 sets of 12 reps: feet shoulder-width, lower until thighs parallel to floor
Push-ups (or modified) - 3 sets of 10 reps: hands shoulder-width, lower chest to floor
Lunges - 3 sets of 10 each leg: step forward, lower back knee toward floor
Bent-Over Rows (use water bottles if no weights) - 3 sets of 12: hinge at hips, pull elbows back
Glute Bridges - 3 sets of 15: lie on back, lift hips squeezing glutes at top
Plank Hold - 3 sets of 30 seconds: maintain straight line from head to heels
Cool down: 3 minutes of stretching

name: Dance Cardio Fun
description: Fun dance workout to boost mood and burn calories when energy is high.
benefits: Improves mood, burns calories, improves coordination, fun way to exercise
instructions: Start with simple side steps to warm up - 2 minutes
Add arm movements - reach up, punch forward, wave side to side
Grapevine steps - step side, step behind, step side, tap
Body rolls and hip movements - let the music guide you
Jump and turn sequences when comfortable
Cool down with slow swaying movements
No pressure to be perfect - just move and have fun!

name: PMS Relief Yoga
description: Yoga sequence specifically designed to ease PMS symptoms including mood swings, breast tenderness, and irritability.
benefits: Reduces PMS symptoms, calms irritability, eases breast tenderness, improves mood
instructions: Start seated - close eyes and take 5 deep breaths to center yourself
Seated Forward Fold - extend legs, fold forward gently, hold 1 minute
Supported Fish Pose - place block between shoulder blades, let chest open, hold 2 minutes
Wide-Legged Forward Fold - stand with legs wide, fold forward, let head hang, hold 1 minute
Reclined Bound Angle - lie back, soles together, knees wide, arms relaxed, hold 3 minutes
Legs Up the Wall - lie with legs resting on wall, stay 3-5 minutes
Final rest in Savasana for 2 minutes

name: Water Exercises
description: Low-impact water exercises that reduce joint stress and provide relief during menstruation.
benefits: Zero impact on joints, relieves cramps through water pressure, cooling effect, full body workout
instructions: Water walking - walk back and forth in chest-deep water for 5 minutes
Leg kicks - hold pool edge, kick legs straight back and forth, 2 minutes
Arm circles - stand in shoulder-deep water, make large circles with arms, 30 seconds each direction
Jogging in place - lift knees high in chest-deep water, 3 minutes
Side steps - step sideways along pool length, back and forth 3 times
Floating rest - relax on back (use pool noodle if needed), float for 2 minutes
Cool down with gentle swimming or floating

name: Chair Yoga for Low Energy
description: Gentle yoga you can do sitting in a chair for days when standing feels too difficult.
benefits: Accessible when energy is lowest, reduces cramps, can be done at office, improves posture
instructions: Seated Cat-Cow - sit tall, inhale arch back, exhale round spine, repeat 10 times
Seated Twist - sit tall, place right hand on left knee, twist left, hold 30 seconds each side
Seated Forward Fold - sit at edge of chair, fold forward over legs, let head hang, hold 1 minute
Neck Stretches - drop ear to shoulder, hold 30 seconds each side
Ankle Circles - lift one foot, circle ankle 10 times each direction, switch feet
Seated Figure-4 - cross ankle over opposite knee, gentle lean forward, hold 30 seconds each side
Final breath: Close eyes, take 5 deep breaths

name: Foam Rolling for Recovery
description: Self-myofascial release using a foam roller to reduce muscle tension and improve circulation.
benefits: Releases muscle knots, improves blood flow, reduces soreness, aids recovery, relieves lower back tension
instructions: Lower Back - sit on roller at lower back, support with hands behind you, gently roll up and down, 1-2 minutes
Upper Back - lie with roller at shoulder blade level, arms crossed, roll from mid to upper back, 1-2 minutes
Glutes - sit on roller, cross right ankle over left knee, roll right glute, 1 minute each side
IT Band - lie on side with roller under outer thigh, roll from hip to knee, 1 minute each side
Calves - sit with roller under calves, roll from ankle to knee, 1 minute
Quads - lie face down with roller under thighs, roll from hip to knee, 1-2 minutes

name: Pilates for Core & Posture
description: Classical Pilates exercises to strengthen core, improve posture, and build lean muscle.
benefits: Stronger core, better posture, lean muscle, improved body awareness, enhanced flexibility
instructions: The Hundred - lie on back, legs at tabletop, arms pump up and down, 100 pumps with breath pattern
Roll Up - lie flat, arms overhead, slowly roll up to seated reaching for toes, roll back down, 8 reps
Single Leg Circles - lie on back, one leg to ceiling, draw small circles, 5 each direction per leg
Rolling Like a Ball - sit with knees to chest, roll back and up to balance, 8 rolls
Single Leg Stretch - lie on back, one knee to chest, other leg extended, alternate, 10 each side
Spine Stretch Forward - sit tall with legs wide, reach forward rounding spine, 5 reps
Side Kicks - lie on side, kick top leg front and back, 10 each direction per side
Final stretch and rest

name: Tension Release Meditation
description: Guided body scan meditation to systematically release tension stored in the body during menstruation.
benefits: Deep relaxation, reduces muscle tension, calms anxiety, improves body awareness, better sleep
instructions: Lie down comfortably with support under knees if needed
Close eyes and take 5 deep breaths
Bring attention to feet - notice any tension, breathe into the area, release
Move attention to calves, then thighs - same process of noticing and releasing
Focus on lower belly and uterus - send breath and warmth to this area
Continue up through stomach, chest, shoulders, arms, hands
Relax face - jaw, around eyes, forehead
Scan entire body one more time, letting go of any remaining tension
Rest in stillness for 2 minutes before slowly opening eyes

name: Belly Dance Hip Work
description: Belly dance movements focusing on hip isolations to strengthen pelvic muscles and boost confidence.
benefits: Strengthens pelvic floor, improves hip mobility, boosts confidence, fun and feminine movement
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, slight bend in knees
Hip Drops - shift weight to one hip and drop it down, alternate sides, 20 each side
Hip Circles - draw circles with hips, 10 clockwise, 10 counterclockwise
Figure 8s - trace horizontal figure 8 with hips, 20 reps
Hip Shimmies - rapidly alternate hip drops, start slow, speed up, 30 seconds
Undulations - create wave motion from chest through belly to hips
Put it all together with music - dance freely incorporating moves learned
